member.name: M:MudBlazor.Extensions.Components.MudExList`1.HandleCentralValueCommander(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: CentralCommander has a simple aim: Prevent racing conditions. It has two mechanism to do this: (1) When this method is running, it doesn't allow to run a second one. That guarantees to different value parameters can not call this method at the same time. (2) When this method runs once, prevents all value setters until OnAfterRender runs. That guarantees to have proper values.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Extensions.Components.MudExVirtualize`1.OverscanCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how many additional items will be rendered before and after the visible region. This help to reduce the frequency of rendering during scrolling. However, higher values mean that more elements will be present in the page.

member.name: P:MudBlazor.Extensions.Components.MudExVirtualize`1.SpacerElement
member.summary:
Gets or sets the tag name of the HTML element that will be used as the virtualization spacer. One such element will be rendered before the visible items, and one more after them, using an explicit "height" style to control the scroll range.
The default value is "div". If you are placing the instance inside an element that requires a specific child tag name, consider setting that here. For example when rendering inside a "tbody", consider setting to the value "tr".

member.summary: The border is a series of dots.

member.summary: The border is a series of short lines.

member.summary: The border is a single, solid line.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Double
member.summary: The border is two solid lines. The sum of the two lines and the space between them equals the value of 'border-width'.

member.summary: The border looks as though it were carved into the canvas.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Ridge
member.summary: The opposite of 'groove': the border looks as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Inset
member.summary: The border makes the box look as though it were embedded in the canvas.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Outset
member.summary: The opposite of 'inset': the border makes the box look as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.summary: Sets this property to its default value.

member.summary: Inherits this property from its parent element.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Revert
member.summary: Resets the property to its inherited value if it inherits from its parent, and to its initial value if not.

member.name: F:MudBlazor.Extensions.Core.Css.BorderStyle.Unset
member.summary: Can be used on any CSS property, including 'border-style', and takes the same values as inherit. It acts like inherit if the property is inherited and like initial if not.

member.summary: Displays a dialog that allows the user to edit a collection of items.
member.typeparam: The type of items to edit.
member.param: The dialog service instance used to display the dialog.
The title of the dialog.
The header text displayed in the dialog.
A function that asynchronously loads the items to be edited.
Indicates whether the dialog allows adding and removing items. Defaults to true.
Specifies whether canceling the dialog is allowed. If false, the close button will be disabled.
A function used to validate the edited items. The dialog is confirmed only if this function returns true. If not provided, a default validation is applied (always valid).
A function to convert each item into its string representation. If not provided, the item's ToString() method is used.
Optional dialog options to customize the behavior and appearance of the dialog.
An optional action to configure additional parameters for the dialog.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The result contains the edited array of items if the dialog was confirmed, or the original items if the dialog was canceled.

member.summary: Displays a dialog that allows the user to edit a collection of items. This overload accepts a predefined collection of items.
member.typeparam: The type of items to edit.
member.param: The dialog service instance used to display the dialog.
The title of the dialog.
The header text displayed in the dialog.
The collection of items to be edited.
Indicates whether the dialog allows adding and removing items. Defaults to true.
Specifies whether canceling the dialog is allowed. If false, the dialog cannot be closed without confirming a valid edit.
A function used to validate the edited items. The dialog is confirmed only if this function returns true.
A function to convert each item into its string representation. If not provided, the item's ToString() method is used.
Optional dialog options to customize the behavior and appearance of the dialog.
An optional action to configure additional parameters for the dialog.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The result contains the edited array of items if the dialog was confirmed, or the original items if the dialog was canceled.

member.summary: Adds a background property to the builder. The background is a gradient of a concatenated list of two palettes, default and dark.
member.param: The theme to use.
If false, no property will be added to the builder.
